meanings.definition: To bring back to life or consciousness.
meanings.sent1: After the doctor performed CPR, the man was reviving.
meanings.sent2: The paramedics were successful in reviving the patient after the accident.
meanings.sent3: The old computer was reviving after getting a new battery.
meanings.sent4: Her kind words were like reviving sunshine on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh flowers was reviving, filling the room with life.

meanings.definition: To give new strength or energy to.
meanings.sent1: A good night's sleep can be reviving after a long day.
meanings.sent2: The coach's motivational speech was reviving for the team before the game.
meanings.sent3: The cup of coffee was reviving, waking him up for the morning meeting.
meanings.sent4: The music was like a reviving force, energizing the crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent5: The refreshing drink was reviving, quenching their thirst on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To become conscious or active again.
meanings.sent1: The patient was slowly reviving after being unconscious for hours.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the garden were reviving as the sun rose in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The old tradition was reviving, gaining popularity among the youth.
meanings.sent4: Her interest in painting was reviving, sparking creativity in her once more.
meanings.sent5: The town was reviving with activity as the festival brought people together.
